intro: Habranthus mexicanus, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant produces small, clustered berries that are edible and contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Habranthus mexicanus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
